page.title: 01Shira Dam and district
page.content: This area is primarly used by sheep for grazing. Some forestry and a dam used in the generation of electricity. The concrete dam features on the lndscape with its ancillary roads buildings and overhead cables. The are is visited only by electricity board workers. shepherds nd the occasional fisherman who tries his luck in the waters of the dam. The area could be termed upland rising to high land. As such grassland, heath and several small lochs and streams can be found in the area. Quarries used to provide material for the construction of the dam scar the landscape along with rarely used construction site roads the Shira dam forms part of a major electricity generation scheme and makes a major contriution to electricity input servicing the national grid.
